poem:
**The Vanishing**

In the shadow of discourse,  
cold vans hum,  
sweeping dreams  
into cages,  
where whispers of freedom  
grow faint.  
  
Names erased like chalk,  
lives unstitched  
before the dawn.  
  
Yet the heart keeps  
its silent vigil—  
pulse of defiance,  
waiting for the dawn.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
